summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Correctional Center, demanding all audio recordings and records of telephone calls to or from inmate Jeffrey Epstein from July 6-11, 2019, with specific exclusions. It includes a rider, a declaration of custodian of records form, and a cover letter requesting confidentiality.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena seeks records of his telephone calls while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from July 6-11, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying cover letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Eric Blachman
persons.context: Named as a point of contact for the production of subpoenaed records, along with an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: His name and phone number are listed as an exclusion; communications with him are not to be produced in response to the subpoena.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: His name and phone number are listed as an exclusion; communications with him are not to be produced in response to the subpoena.

connections.description: Epstein's communications with Fernich are specifically excluded from the subpoena, indicating a protected legal relationship.
Epstein's communications with Weinberg are specifically excluded from the subpoena, indicating a protected legal relationship.
Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the official authorizing the subpoena for records related to inmate Epstein as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the Metropolitan Correctional Center to appear before the grand jury on this date to produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by the return date.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Targeted Call Records Period
events.description: The subpoena specifically requests all available audio recordings and records of telephone calls to or from Jeffrey Epstein during this six-day period.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks all telephone call records for Jeffrey Epstein from July 6 to July 11, 2019, while he was an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Communications with attorneys Marc Fernich and Martin Weinberg are explicitly excluded from production, indicating they were his legal counsel.
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the subpoena's existence to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document is dated July 11, 2019, which is the day before Epstein's scheduled death in custody on August 10, 2019, making it a record from the final weeks of his life.
The investigation cited involves alleged violations of federal statutes related to sex trafficking (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 1594(c), 2422(b)).
